intro: Sphaeralcea orbiculata subsp. clementina, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its round, fuzzy leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. This subspecies is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
